page.title: 06FARMING IN BADENOCH - 3
page.content: As the farms here lie close to, if not in, the flood plain of the Spey Valley the risk of{flooding}is constant. The Spey waters are held back at{Spey Dam, some 14 miles up river and if the overflow gates are opened due to a build up there a sudden heavy flow ensues. In such circumstances the police are notified and a{flood {warning telephone system}instigated. A call at{4 am}is not unusual and farmers may have to venture out to ensure the livestock will be safe. To round up and count 70 head of cattle on a dark and stormy night requires a special{dedication}and of course his whole livlihood depends on this commitment. His work is a 7 day week job although, once the livestock is attended to time can be found for market, shopping or a game of{curling.
